tldr: June quarter revenue rose 10% to $94B and EPS increased 12% to $1.57 as iPhone, Mac, and services all grew double digits. Apple guided September-quarter revenue to mid-to-high single-digit growth with gross margin of 46%-47% and tariff cost impact of about $1.1B.
bullets: Revenue was $94B (+10% YoY) with EPS of $1.57 (+12% YoY); services reached a record $27.4B (+13%).
iPhone revenue grew 13% to $44.6B; Mac revenue rose 15% to $8.0B; iPad revenue was $6.6B.
September quarter outlook: revenue mid-to-high single digits, gross margin 46%-47% including ~$1.1B tariff cost impact.
themes: Pricing and cost pressure shaping margins

segments.title: iPhone
points: Revenue was $44.6B, up 13% YoY with record June-quarter upgraders.
iPhone 16 family performance drove growth across all regions.

segments.title: Mac and iPad
points: Mac revenue rose 15% to $8.0B on M4 MacBook Air strength.
iPad revenue was $6.6B with a difficult compare versus prior-year launches.

segments.title: Services
points: Revenue hit a record $27.4B, up 13% YoY with broad-based category acceleration.
App Store revenue grew double digits and cloud services hit an all-time record.

notes.title: Tariffs
points: June quarter tariff costs were about $800M.
September quarter tariff costs estimated at about $1.1B under current policy assumptions.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Returned over $27B to shareholders, including $21B in buybacks.

themes.title: AI investment and CapEx
points: CapEx is rising on AI investments and Private Cloud Compute capacity.
Hybrid model uses both first-party and third-party data centers.

themes.title: Tariff pull-ahead
points: Management estimated about 1 point of Q3 growth from pull-ahead demand.
Pull-ahead was mainly in iPhone and Mac and mostly in the U.S.

top_questions.question: What drove the strong June quarter iPhone performance?
top_questions.summary: Record upgraders and strong iPhone 16 family demand across regions.

top_questions.question: How is Apple managing tariff exposure?
top_questions.summary: Supply chain optimization and sourcing shifts; outlook assumes current tariff rates hold.

top_questions.question: Is services strength impacted by the Epic ruling?
top_questions.summary: Management said services growth was broad-based; changes were implemented late in the quarter.

implications: Services momentum supports margin stability despite tariff costs.
AI investment ramp is becoming a larger driver of CapEx.
competitive_notes: Supply chain diversification toward India and Vietnam continues for U.S. sales.
forecast_hooks: Track September quarter tariff costs versus $1.1B estimate.
Monitor services growth rate relative to June-quarter pace.

action_items: Validate upgrade rates and switcher mix for iPhone 16 family.
Watch CapEx trend as AI investments expand.
open_questions: Magnitude of tariff headwinds if policies change post-September.
Timing of more personalized Siri features.
watch_next_quarter: September quarter revenue growth versus mid-to-high single digit guide.
Gross margin performance with tariff cost impact.
